3.description: Ruling as Queen Regent for her young son Tommen after Joffrey's death and Tyrion's escape. Paranoid and increasingly unstable.

relationships.Margaery Tyrell: New queen she sees as threat

12.description: Grows increasingly paranoid about the Tyrells and their influence over Tommen. Makes poor political decisions.

24.description: Arms the Faith Militant to use against her enemies, not realizing the danger this poses to herself.

39.description: Arrested by the Faith Militant for adultery, incest, and treason. Her own weapon turned against her.

4.description: Searching for Sansa Stark as sworn to Catelyn, accompanied by Podrick Payne. Following leads through the Riverlands.

14.description: Encounters various characters in her search, including innkeepers and common folk affected by the war.

31.description: Her search leads her deeper into the war-torn Riverlands where she faces various dangers and meets colorful characters.

42.description: Captured by a mysterious figure and the transformed Brotherhood.

2.description: Heir to Dorne, plotting to crown Myrcella as queen to spite the Iron Throne. Sensual and ambitious princess.

relationships.Doran Martell: Father whose plans she doesn't know

21.description: Executes her plan to crown Myrcella, but it goes wrong when they're intercepted. Arys Oakheart dies in the attempt.

40.description: Imprisoned by her father, who reveals his deeper game and the dangers of her reckless actions.

relationships.Doran Martell: Father who reveals his true plans

13.description: Captain of Prince Doran's guards, originally from Norvos. Loyal servant watching over the Water Gardens.

21.description: Intercepts Arianne's conspiracy to crown Myrcella, leading to Arys Oakheart's death in combat.

13.description: Kingsguard sworn to protect Myrcella in Dorne. Struggling with his vows as Arianne seduces him.

21.description: Dies fighting Areo Hotah when their plot to crown Myrcella is discovered. Dies for love and ambition.

11.description: Priest of the Drowned God and brother to Balon Greyjoy. Calls for a kingsmoot after Balon's death.

29.description: Opposed to Euron's claim to the Seastone Chair, calling for the ancient kingsmoot to choose the new king.

45.description: Witnesses Euron's victory at the kingsmoot despite his efforts to prevent it. The Drowned God seems to abandon him.

relationships.Euron Greyjoy: Brother who becomes king despite his opposition

18.description: Lord Captain of the Iron Fleet and brother to Balon. Strong but not particularly intelligent warrior.

29.description: Competes for the throne at the kingsmoot but loses to Euron's promises and magic horn.

relationships.Euron Greyjoy: Brother who defeats him for crown

45.description: Forced to acknowledge Euron as king after losing the kingsmoot. Bitter about his defeat.

relationships.Euron Greyjoy: Brother and new king he must serve

23.description: Hidden in the Vale as Petyr Baelish's bastard daughter Alayne. Learning to play the game of thrones under his tutelage.

relationships.Robert Arryn: Sickly young lord she helps care for

41.description: Witnesses Petyr push Lysa Arryn to her death and begins to understand his true nature and methods.

relationships.Robert Arryn: Young lord now under their control

6.description: Arrives in Braavos and seeks out the House of Black and White using Jaqen H'ghar's iron coin.
6.role: Novice at House of Black and White

22.description: Begins training as an acolyte of the Faceless Men, learning to give up her identity.

34.description: Struggles with abandoning her identity as Arya Stark while training in the arts of death.

relationships.Many-Faced God: Deity she struggles to serve fully

5.description: Travels to Oldtown with Gilly and Maester Aemon to become a maester and research the Others.

relationships.Gilly: Wildling woman and her baby he protects

35.description: Arrives in Oldtown to begin his training at the Citadel while dealing with Gilly and the baby.

8.description: Trying to rebuild the Kingsguard and restore honor to the white cloak after losing his sword hand.

relationships.Cersei Lannister: Twin sister grown cold toward him

27.description: Sent to deal with problems in the Riverlands, trying to end conflicts without unnecessary bloodshed.

44.description: Successfully ends the siege of Riverrun through negotiation rather than force, showing his growth as a leader.

relationships.Cersei Lannister: Sister who no longer controls him

29.description: Returns to the Iron Islands claiming to have sailed the world. Possesses a mysterious horn that can bind dragons.

45.description: Wins the kingsmoot by promising to conquer Westeros with dragons, showing his horn that supposedly controls them.

12.description: Now Queen to Tommen, but facing increasing hostility from Cersei who sees her as a threat to her power.

relationships.Cersei Lannister: Queen Mother who plots against her

39.description: Arrested by the Faith Militant on charges of adultery and fornication, part of Cersei's schemes backfiring.

2.description: Prince of Dorne who appears weak and cautious, but harbors secret plans for vengeance against the Lannisters.

relationships.Arianne Martell: Daughter whose plots he must stop
relationships.Oberyn Martell: Brother whose death he seeks to avenge

40.description: Reveals his long-term plans to Arianne, showing that his caution masks deeper schemes for revenge.

relationships.Arianne Martell: Daughter he must educate about patience

42.description: A mysterious hooded figure who now leads the Brotherhood Without Banners with ruthless methods.

24.description: Humble septon from the Riverlands chosen as High Septon. Leads the sparrow movement advocating for the poor.

39.description: Arrests both Cersei and Margaery for various sins, showing the Faith's newfound power over the crown.

3.description: Former maester stripped of his chain for forbidden experiments. Now serves Cersei as Master of Whisperers.

12.description: Provides Cersei with information and counsel, conducting dark experiments in his chambers.

3.description: Handsome bastard from House Velaryon appointed to rebuild the royal fleet. Resembles Rhaegar Targaryen.
3.role: Grand Admiral and Master of Ships

17.description: Uses his position to build a powerful fleet while playing to Cersei's attraction to him.

3.description: Lord of Longtable appointed as Hand of the King by Cersei. Weak-willed and easily controlled.

24.description: Proves ineffective as Hand, often overshadowed by his more cunning wife Taena.

3.description: Myrish wife of Lord Merryweather who becomes Cersei's close friend and confidante.

17.description: Gains Cersei's trust through flattery and shared intimacies, possibly reporting to other masters.

39.description: Harsh septa who guards and torments Cersei during her imprisonment by the Faith.

24.description: Cersei's cousin and former lover who has joined the Faith Militant as penance for his sins.

39.description: Provides testimony against Cersei to the Faith, revealing their past adultery and Robert's death.

3.description: Hedge knight from a lowborn family appointed to the Kingsguard by Cersei. Secretly working for Littlefinger.

39.description: Arrested and tortured by the Faith Militant, confessing to adultery with both Cersei and Margaery.

3.description: Brother to Osmund, serves as captain of the City Watch under Cersei's patronage.

28.description: Third Kettleblack brother used by Cersei in her plots against Margaery Tyrell.

39.description: Arrested by the Faith and confesses under torture to adultery with both queens.

3.description: Young king controlled by his mother Cersei. Gentle and easily influenced, unlike his brother Joffrey.

12.description: Torn between his love for his wife Margaery and obedience to his mother Cersei.

2.description: Young princess sent to Dorne for protection, now pawn in Arianne's plot to make her queen.

relationships.Arianne Martell: Princess who wants to crown her

21.description: Injured when Arianne's plot fails, losing an ear to Areo Hotah's axe during the confrontation.

12.description: Court jester who may have been one of Cersei's lovers, adding to her reputation.

3.description: Ancient Grand Maester who has served many kings, now growing increasingly frail and less useful to Cersei.

relationships.Cersei Lannister: Queen who finds him increasingly useless

12.description: Lord of Highgarden and father to Margaery. Pompous but politically naive compared to his mother.

relationships.Margaery Tyrell: Daughter he wants to see as queen
relationships.Olenna Tyrell: Mother who truly leads their house

17.description: Appointed Master of Ships by Cersei in an attempt to separate the Tyrells from power.

12.description: Sharp-tongued grandmother who truly leads House Tyrell. Sees through Cersei's schemes.
12.role: Dowager and true power of Highgarden

39.description: Works to protect Margaery from the Faith's accusations while maneuvering against Cersei.

relationships.High Sparrow: Religious leader she must deal with

12.description: Skilled knight and brother to Margaery, serving in the Kingsguard to protect his sister.

39.description: Arrested by the Faith Militant on charges of homosexuality and fornication.

8.description: Honorable knight of the Kingsguard, one of the few decent men in the white cloaks.
Disgraced Kingsguard knight, cowardly and gluttonous, serves as Tommen's food taster.
Brutal Kingsguard knight known for his cruelty, particularly toward those who cannot defend themselves.
Young knight appointed to replace fallen Kingsguard members. Eager but inexperienced.

4.description: Young squire accompanying Brienne in her search for Sansa. Loyal despite the dangers they face.

relationships.Tyrion Lannister: Former master who sent him away

20.description: Proves his courage and loyalty despite his youth, standing by Brienne through various trials.

25.description: Humble septon who travels the riverlands ministering to the smallfolk. Wise and compassionate.

31.description: Leads Brienne and Pod to the Quiet Isle, sharing wisdom about war and broken men.
Leader of the peaceful monks on the Quiet Isle. Claims to have buried the Hound after his fight with Arya.

relationships.Sandor Clegane: Hound he claims to have buried

25.description: Knight who bet on Brienne's maidenhood at Renly's court, now seeking redemption by joining her quest.

42.description: Captured alongside Brienne by the transformed Brotherhood.
Red priest troubled by the Brotherhood's new ruthless direction.
Member of the Brotherhood Without Banners under new leadership.

27.description: Catelyn's uncle holding Riverrun against the Lannisters and Freys. Refuses to surrender.

44.description: Escapes Riverrun during the night rather than surrender, continuing his defiance of Lannister rule.

27.description: Lord of Riverrun held prisoner by the Lannisters, used as leverage to end the siege.

44.description: Convinces his uncle to surrender Riverrun to save the lives of the defenders.

32.description: Tywin's brother who refuses to serve as Hand while Cersei holds power, seeing her incompetence.

43.description: Returns to help stabilize the realm after Cersei's arrest, becoming a more central figure in politics.

6.description: Faceless Man who trains Arya at the House of Black and White in Braavos. Patient but demanding teacher.

relationships.Arya Stark: Student he trains to become no one

22.description: Continues Arya's training in the ways of the Faceless Men, teaching her to abandon her identity.

6.description: Young-looking acolyte at the House of Black and White who dislikes Arya and tests her harshly.

22.description: Continues to challenge and test Arya, serving as both teacher and antagonist in her training.
Faceless Man who appears in different guises, including at the House of Black and White and later at the Citadel.

45.description: Appears at the Citadel in Oldtown disguised as 'Pate,' having killed and taken the identity of an acolyte.

5.description: Wildling girl rescued by Sam, traveling with him and her baby to Oldtown for safety.

relationships.Samwell Tarly: Man who protects her and her child

35.description: Struggles to adapt to civilized life in Oldtown while caring for her baby son.

5.description: Ancient maester traveling to Oldtown with Sam. Blind and frail but still wise.

15.description: Dies during the journey to Oldtown, but not before sharing final wisdom about dragons and Targaryens.

35.description: Archmaester at the Citadel interested in magic and prophecy, unlike most maesters who scorn such things.

relationships.Samwell Tarly: New student he takes interest in

45.description: Reveals the Citadel's conspiracy against magic and dragons, then departs on a mysterious mission.

relationships.Daenerys Targaryen: Dragon queen he seeks to find

35.description: Dornish student at the Citadel who befriends Sam. Skilled with a bow and quick-witted.

45.description: Helps Sam navigate the Citadel's politics and seems to know more than he reveals about various matters.

23.description: Lord Protector of the Vale who has taken Sansa under his protection as his bastard daughter Alayne.

relationships.Sansa Stark: Hidden ward he protects and trains

41.description: Murders Lysa Arryn by pushing her through the Moon Door to maintain control over the Vale.

23.description: Lady of the Vale and Catelyn's sister, now married to Petyr. Unstable and obsessed with him.

41.description: Killed by Petyr when her jealousy and instability threaten his plans and Sansa's safety.

23.description: Sickly young Lord of the Vale, prone to seizures and coddled by his mother Lysa.

relationships.Sansa Stark: Alayne who helps care for him

41.description: Now under Petyr's control after his mother's death, with Sansa helping to care for him.

23.description: Robert Baratheon's bastard daughter who works as a guide in the Vale, skilled with mules.
Hereditary High Steward of the Vale, ambitious knight seeking to rise in station.

41.description: Powerful Vale lord who leads the Lords Declarant opposing Petyr's rule over young Robert.
Dangerous knight secretly in Petyr's pay, pretending to oppose him while actually serving his interests.
Stern Vale lady who serves as one of the Lords Declarant opposing Petyr's rule.
Vale lord who joins the Lords Declarant in opposing Petyr Baelish's rule over the Vale.
Young lord of House Hunter who participates in the Lords Declarant against Petyr.
Vale knight who stands with the Lords Declarant in opposing Littlefinger's rule.

23.description: Maester serving the Arryns at the Eyrie, often treating Robert's various ailments.
Wet nurse and caregiver to Robert Arryn, one of the few servants who can handle him.

relationships.Lysa Arryn: Mother who trusts her with Robert

23.description: Blind singer who serves at the Eyrie, having been blinded for attempting to rape Sansa.

41.description: Blamed for Lysa's murder by Petyr and thrown to his death from the Eyrie.

17.description: Former Lord Commander of City Watch, exiled to the Night's Watch for his corruption.

relationships.Night's Watch: Order he was sent to join

17.description: Leader of the Black Ears mountain clan who served Tyrion and now lingers in King's Landing.
One-eyed leader of the Burned Men who served Tyrion and remains in King's Landing.
Sellsword who served Tyrion faithfully but now serves Cersei for gold and knighthood.

24.description: Uses his newfound status and wealth to establish himself among the nobility.

relationships.Lollys Stokeworth: Simple wife he married for lands

17.description: Simple-minded daughter of a minor house, brutalized during the riots and now pregnant.

relationships.House Stokeworth: Minor noble house she belongs to

17.description: Lady of House Stokeworth who seeks to marry her daughter Lollys to someone of worth.
Elder daughter of House Stokeworth, married to Ser Balman Byrch and bitter about inheritance.

32.description: Becomes one of Qyburn's experimental subjects after attempting to oppose Bronn's rise.

17.description: Knight married to Falyse Stokeworth, ambitious but not particularly competent.

3.description: Young serving girl in the Red Keep who becomes one of Cersei's bedmaids and confidantes.

relationships.Cersei Lannister: Queen she serves and reports to

3.description: One of Cersei's personal maids who helps dress the queen and tends to her needs.
Another of Cersei's personal servants who attends to the queen's daily needs.

24.description: One of the leading septons in the sparrow movement under the High Sparrow.
Septon who supports the sparrow movement and the arming of the Faith Militant.
One of the septons who joins the sparrow movement in King's Landing.

relationships.High Sparrow: Leader he follows in religious reform

39.description: Harsh septa who helps guard Cersei during her imprisonment by the Faith.
Another of the septas involved in guarding and tormenting Cersei during her captivity.

42.description: Member of the Brotherhood Without Banners serving under Lady Stoneheart's vengeful leadership.
Skilled archer of the Brotherhood who now serves Lady Stoneheart's thirst for vengeance.
One of the Brotherhood Without Banners now following Lady Stoneheart's merciless justice.
Former member of Ned Stark's household guard who joined the Brotherhood and now serves Lady Stoneheart.

relationships.Lady Stoneheart: Former lady he serves in undeath

42.description: Tyroshi member of the Brotherhood with a distinctive green beard, now serving Lady Stoneheart.
Singer and spy for the Brotherhood, now helping Lady Stoneheart's campaign of vengeance.

9.description: Innkeeper's daughter at the Inn at the Crossroads who serves Brienne and Podrick.
Another daughter of the innkeeper at the crossroads, working at the inn.
Man now running the Inn at the Crossroads after Masha Heddle's death during the war.

20.description: Former member of the Brave Companions, now a murderous outlaw in the riverlands.

25.description: Killed by Brienne when he and his companions threaten her and the holy man.

20.description: Brutal former Brave Companion who terrorizes the smallfolk of the riverlands.

25.description: Killed by Brienne in combat when he threatens innocent people.

20.description: Dornish member of the former Brave Companions now turned to banditry and murder.

25.description: Dies fighting Brienne when she defends Septon Meribald and his followers.

relationships.Brienne of Tarth: Knight who kills him in battle

20.description: Local man from Crackclaw Point who offers to guide Brienne in her search for Sansa.

relationships.House Crabb: Minor house he claims descent from

25.description: Killed by the outlaws he leads Brienne to, dying trying to help her.
Large mastiff that accompanies Septon Meribald on his travels through the riverlands.

31.description: Monk living on the Quiet Isle under the Elder Brother's guidance.
Another of the brothers living in peace on the Quiet Isle.
Monk on the Quiet Isle who has taken vows of silence and peace.
Large, silent monk on the Quiet Isle who digs graves and tends to the dead. His identity is mysterious.

relationships.Quiet Isle: Place of peace where he labors

12.description: Second son of Mace Tyrell, skilled warrior and brother to Margaery and Loras.
Eldest son of Mace Tyrell and heir to Highgarden, crippled in a tourney but wise and scholarly.
Lord of the Arbor and master of the largest fleet in Westeros, ally to the Tyrells.
Twin son of Paxter Redwyne, held hostage in King's Landing to ensure his father's loyalty.
Twin son of Paxter Redwyne, also held as hostage in the capital.

3.description: Exiled prince from the Summer Isles who seeks aid to reclaim his throne, frequent at court.

12.description: Lord of Goldengrove and bannerman to the Tyrells, supports Margaery's position as queen.

17.description: Sam's harsh father and one of the finest military commanders in Westeros, serves Mace Tyrell.

35.description: Lord of Oldtown who has become reclusive, spending his time studying magic with his daughter.
Eldest daughter of Lord Hightower, unmarried and studying magic with her father.
Administrator who runs Oldtown while Lord Hightower remains secluded in his tower.
Woman who runs a brothel in Oldtown where Rosey works.
Elderly archmaester at the Citadel, growing senile and forgetful in his old age.
Archmaester at the Citadel who teaches healing and medicine to the students.
Archmaester specializing in mathematics and accounting at the Citadel.
Maester at the Citadel who assists in teaching and administration.

5.description: Surly cook aboard the ship carrying Sam, Gilly and Maester Aemon to Oldtown.

40.description: Doran's eldest son and heir, secretly sent on a mission to court Daenerys Targaryen.

relationships.Daenerys Targaryen: Dragon queen he seeks to marry

2.description: Younger son of Doran Martell, betrothed to Myrcella Baratheon as part of the alliance.

13.description: Elderly knight serving House Martell at Sunspear, past his fighting prime.
Knight from House Uller serving at Sunspear under Prince Doran.
Knight of House Allyrion serving at the Water Gardens in Dorne.
Knight serving at Sunspear who participates in protecting Myrcella.

21.description: Knight of House Dalt who helps intercept Arianne's conspiracy.

42.description: Young Lord of Starfall who served as squire to Beric Dondarrion in the Brotherhood.

27.description: Cousin to Jaime and Cersei, now commanding Lannister forces in the riverlands.
Frey lord married to Genna Lannister, now granted Riverrun as reward for loyalty.
Tywin's sister married to Emmon Frey, sharp-tongued and politically astute.
Son of Emmon Frey and Genna Lannister, killed during the war.
Son of Emmon and Genna who will inherit Riverrun after his father.
Another son of Emmon and Genna, part of the Frey-Lannister branch of the family.
Knight commanding the siege of Riverrun under Jaime's orders.
Knight serving in the Lannister forces besieging Riverrun.

44.description: Frey daughter married to Edmure Tully, now pregnant with his child.

relationships.Edmure Tully: Husband she married at Red Wedding

44.description: Knight serving House Tully at Riverrun during the siege.
Captain of guards at Riverrun, loyal to House Tully through the siege.
Steward of Riverrun who manages the castle's household affairs during the siege.

27.description: Lord of Stone Hedge who has submitted to Lannister rule after his defeat.
Lord of Raventree Hall who continues to resist Lannister rule in the riverlands.
Son and heir of Lord Tytos Blackwood, young knight fighting for his family.
Another son of Lord Blackwood fighting in the riverlands conflict.

8.description: Knight serving in King's Landing, one of many minor nobles at court.
Knight at court in King's Landing during Cersei's regency.
Knight serving at the Red Keep during the tumultuous period of Cersei's rule.
Bastard knight serving the crown in King's Landing.
Another bastard knight in service to the Iron Throne at King's Landing.
Knight in service at the Red Keep during Cersei's regency.

3.description: Young Lannister cousin who disappeared during the riots in King's Landing.
Infant lady married to Tyrek Lannister who disappeared, now a ward.

recaps.1: The aftermath of the War of the Five Kings leaves the realm scarred and struggling.
recaps.2: Arianne Martell plots in Dorne to crown Myrcella as queen against the Iron Throne.
recaps.3: Cersei rules as Queen Regent, growing increasingly paranoid about threats to her power.
recaps.4: Brienne searches for Sansa Stark through the war-torn Riverlands with Podrick.
recaps.5: Sam travels to Oldtown with Gilly and Maester Aemon to begin his training.
recaps.6: Arya arrives in Braavos and seeks the House of Black and White.
recaps.7: Cersei continues to consolidate power while fearing various threats to her rule.
recaps.8: Jaime tries to rebuild the Kingsguard and restore honor to the white cloak.
recaps.9: Brienne continues her quest, encountering the aftermath of war in the Riverlands.
recaps.10: Various characters deal with the consequences of the recent conflicts.
recaps.11: Aeron Damphair learns of Balon Greyjoy's death and calls for a kingsmoot.
recaps.12: Cersei grows increasingly hostile toward Margaery and the Tyrell influence.
recaps.13: In Dorne, various plots unfold involving Arianne, Areo Hotah, and the Martells.
recaps.14: Brienne's journey takes her to the Quiet Isle where she learns of the Hound's fate.
recaps.15: Sam continues his journey to Oldtown, dealing with challenges along the way.
recaps.16: Arys Oakheart struggles with his vows as Arianne continues to seduce him.
recaps.17: Cersei makes increasingly poor decisions while paranoid about enemies.
recaps.18: Victarion Greyjoy prepares for the kingsmoot to choose Balon's successor.
recaps.19: Various political developments unfold across the realm.
recaps.20: Brienne faces dangers in the Riverlands while searching for Sansa.
recaps.21: Arianne's plot to crown Myrcella goes wrong, resulting in Arys Oakheart's death.
recaps.22: Arya begins her training with the Faceless Men in the House of Black and White.
recaps.23: Sansa, disguised as Alayne Stone, learns politics in the Vale under Petyr's tutelage.
recaps.24: Cersei arms the Faith Militant, not realizing the danger this poses to herself.
recaps.25: Brienne's quest continues as she faces various challenges and encounters.
recaps.26: Political maneuvering continues across the realm in the war's aftermath.
recaps.27: Jaime is sent to the Riverlands to deal with ongoing conflicts.
recaps.28: Margaery faces increasing pressure from Cersei's machinations.
recaps.29: The kingsmoot begins on the Iron Islands with Euron's dramatic return.
recaps.30: Jaime attempts to resolve conflicts in the Riverlands through diplomacy.
recaps.31: Brienne encounters Septon Meribald and other colorful characters in her travels.
recaps.32: Cersei's paranoia and poor decisions continue to destabilize her rule.
recaps.33: Various developments occur as the realm adjusts to post-war realities.
recaps.34: Arya struggles with abandoning her identity while training as an assassin.
recaps.35: Sam arrives in Oldtown and begins his studies at the Citadel.
recaps.36: Cersei faces mounting challenges to her authority and decisions.
recaps.37: Brienne's quest takes her deeper into danger as she searches for Sansa.
recaps.38: Political tensions continue to rise across the realm.
recaps.39: Cersei and Margaery face consequences from the Faith Militant.
recaps.40: Doran reveals his true plans to Arianne after her failed conspiracy.
recaps.41: Sansa witnesses shocking events in the Vale and begins to understand Petyr's nature.
recaps.42: Brienne is captured by the transformed Brotherhood Without Banners.
recaps.43: Cersei faces consequences for her actions from the Faith.
recaps.44: Jaime successfully negotiates an end to the siege of Riverrun.
recaps.45: Euron wins the kingsmoot and becomes King of the Iron Islands.
recaps.46: The realm continues to deal with the aftermath of war and political upheaval.
